description: Terminates the specified WorkSpaces. You can terminate a WorkSpace that is in any state except SUSPENDED. This operation is asynchronous and returns before the WorkSpaces have been completely terminated. After a WorkSpace is terminated, the TERMINATED state is returned only briefly before the WorkSpace directory metadata is cleaned up, so this state is rarely returned. To confirm that a WorkSpace is terminated, check for the WorkSpace ID by using DescribeWorkSpaces. If the WorkSpace ID isn't returned, then the WorkSpace has been successfully terminated.

parameters.name: TerminateWorkspaceRequests
parameters.description: The WorkSpaces to terminate. You can specify up to 25 WorkSpaces. (dict) --- Describes the information used to terminate a WorkSpace. WorkspaceId (string) --- The identifier of the WorkSpace.

nested_items.name: FailedRequests
nested_items.description: Information about the WorkSpaces that could not be terminated.

nested_items.name: ErrorCode
nested_items.description: The error code that is returned if the WorkSpace cannot be rebooted.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: The text of the error message that is returned if the WorkSpace cannot be rebooted.
